description: '''The Searchers''' are an English rock group formed in [[Liverpool]] in 1959. Part of the [[Beat music|Merseybeat]] scene, they flourished during the [[British Invasion]] of the 1960s, with hits including "[[Sweets for My Sweet]]", "[[Love Potion No. 9 (song)|Love Potion No. 9]]", "[[Sugar and Spice (The Searchers song)|Sugar and Spice]]", "[[Needles and Pins (song)|Needles and Pins]]", "[[Don't Throw Your Love Away]]", "[[When You Walk in the Room]]", "[[What Have They Done to the Rain]]" and "[[Goodbye My Lover Goodbye|Goodby My Love]]". With the [[The Swinging Blue Jeans|Swinging Blue Jeans]], the Searchers tied for being the second group from Liverpool, after [[the Beatles]], to have a hit in the US, when their "Needles and Pins" and the Swinging Blue Jeans' "[[Hippy Hippy Shake]]" both reached the [[Billboard Hot 100|Hot 100]] on 7 March 1964.
